ViewGroup.description: Group multiple Views together and put them behind a menu.

View.description: This is your root View. It requires a body widget.

title.description: A simple text or a custom widget for the App's title

flexibleBackground.description: This widget (typically used as an background image) acts as the header's background, with the title bar and the bottom widget overlaid on top. On non-scrollable screen, its dimensions is dictated by the header's width and height.

backgroundColor.description: By default the background color uses the theme's 'primary' color. You can override the header's background color here.

surfaceTintColor.description: By default the background color will be generate based on 'primary' color. You can override the header's background color when scrolled over here.

color.description: By default the navigation icon, title, and action icons uses the theme's 'onPrimary' color. You can override their colors here.

elevation.description: Raise the header on its z-coordinates relative to the body. This effectively creates a drop shadow on the header's bottom edge.

shadowColor.description: If elevation is non-zero, this will override the drop shadow color of the header's bottom edge.

centerTitle.description: Whether to align the title in the title bar's center horizontally (default: true)

titleBarHeight.description: For consistency, the header's title bar has the default fixed height of 56 regardless of its content. You may adjust its height here.

flexibleMinHeight.description: Applicable only if scrollableView is enabled. This attribute effectively sets the header's min height on scrolling (header's height will varies between the flexibleMinHeight and flexibleMaxHeight). Note that this attribute will be ignored if smaller than the titleBarHeight

flexibleMaxHeight.description: Applicable only if scrollableView is enabled. This attribute effectively sets the header's max height on scrolling (header's height will varies between the flexibleMinHeight and flexibleMaxHeight). This attribute will be ignored if smaller than the flexibleMinHeight

minSize.description: Minimum size of till sheet can go. Default is 0.25 i.e 25% of screen.

maxSize.description: Maximum size of till sheet can go. Default is 1 i.e 100% of screen.

span.description: Whether the widget should snap between [snapSizes] when the user lifts their finger during a drag.

spanSizes.description: The list of number each ranging from minSize to maxSize.

fixedContent.description: Provide content to be fixed in the footer

onMinSize.description: Execute an Action when the drag hits minimum size

onMaxSize.description: Execute an Action when the drag hits maximum size

onLoad.description: Execute an Action when the screen loads

type.description: Specify if this is a regular (default) or modal screen

useSafeArea.description: Applicable only when we don't have a header. If true, insert paddings around the body content to account for the the devices' Safe Area (e.g. iPhone notch). Default is false.

scrollableView.description: Specify if the content of this screen is scrollable with a global scrollbar. Using this also allow you to customize the scrolling experience of the header.

unfocus.description: Specify if the keyboard should dismissed automatically when tapping in the non interactive widgets. Default (false)

showNavigationIcon.description: For a screen with header, the App will automatically show the Menu, Back, or Close icon (for modal screen) before the title. On modal screen without the header, the Close icon will be shown. Set this flag to false if you wish to hide the icons and handle the navigation yourself.

navigationIconPosition.description: On modal screen without a header, you can position the close button at the start or end of the screen. For left-to-right languages like English, start is on the left and end is on the right. This property has no effect on a screen with header.

Functions.description: Javascript snippet for declaring variables and reusable functions, visible anywhere within this screen

Global.label: Enter code snippet

defaultSnippets.label: Define variables and functions in Javascript

inputs.description: Define the list of input names that this API accepts

headers.description: Pass the headers' key/value pairs to your service

parameters.description: Specify the key/value pairs to pass along with the URL

body.description: The request body to pass along with the URL

onResponse.description: Execute this callback upon a successful return of the API (http code 200-299).

onError.description: Execute this callback when the API returns an error.

inputs.description: Define the list of inputs that ths socket accepts

onSuccess.description: Execute this callback upon a successful connection of socket with server

onError.description: Execute this callback upon a encountering error while trying to do socket connection.

onDisconnect.description: Execute this callback upon a successful disconnect of socket with server

onReconnectAttempt.description: Execute this callback upon auto reconnect is attempted

onReceive.description: Execute this callback upon a message from socket is received. Use socketName.data to access the

disconnectOnPageClose.description: Whether to disconnect socket on page pop. Default true.

autoReconnect.description: Whether to attempt socket connection on interrupted. Default true.

initial.description: Initial wait to do reconnect attempt.

maxStep.description: When to stop increasing wait time e.g initial 1 and maxStep 3 wait time is as follows [1, 2, 4, 4, 4, ...].

inputs.description: Define the list of input names that this Custom Widget accepts.

onLoad.description: Execute an Action when this Custom Widget loads

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget
A unique identifier for this widget

textStyle.description: Styling for regular text. Default to theme's bodyMedium styling

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

onLinkTap.description: Call Ensemble's built-in functions to handle the case when a link within the HTML is tapped. When specified, the default behavior of opening the url will not be invoked.

selector.description: The CSS selector for the element

properties.description: The CSS properties to apply for a given selector

backgroundColor.description: The background color of the element

fontFamily.description: The Font Family for the text of the given tag

fontFamilyFallback.description: The list of font families to fall back on when a glyph cannot be found in default font family.

fontSize.description: Font Size for the text which is inside a tag

fontStyle.description: The styling to give to the text of a tag

fontWeight.description: Font Weight for the text which is inside a tag

height.description: The height for the given tag

lineHeight.description: Line height for the text which is inside a tag

listStyleImage.description: Equivalent to the CSS attribute list-style-image

listStyleType.description: Equivalent to the CSS attribute list-style-type

listStylePosition.description: Equivalent to the CSS attribute list-style-position

padding.description: Padding for the element, fully supports the CSS syntax to pass individual paddings

margin.description: Margin for the element, fully supports the CSS syntax to pass individual paddings

textAlign.description: Text Align for the text which can be inside a selected tag

textDecoration.description: Text decoration to give to the text inside the selected tag

textDecorationColor.description: The color for the text decoration

textDecorationStyle.description: The styling to give to the text decoration

textDecorationThickness.description: The thickness for the text decoration

textShadow.description: Equivalent to that of CSS attribute text-shadow

verticalAlign.description: The vertical alignment for a given tag, default (baseline)

whiteSpace.description: Equivalent to that of CSS attribute white-space

width.description: The width for the given tag

border.description: The border for the tag selected. Follows the css syntax

alignment.description: The alignment of the selected tag

maxLines.description: The maximum number of lines for the text to have

textOverflow.description: Defines on what to do when text overflows or when the lines are more than maxLines

textTransform.description: Perform the given operation to the text inside the selected tag

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

onTap.description: Call Ensemble's built-in functions or execute code

onTapHaptic.description: The different types of haptic to play on Tap. The enums are in the decreasing order of intensity from highest intensity being of heavyImpact and lowest of selectionClick.

splashColor.description: If onTap is defined, this color will show up as a splash effect upon tapping the icon. Note that the effect only happens if backgroundColor is not set.

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

cache.description: To put the image in the cache

source.description: URL to or asset name of the image. If the URL is used, it is highly recommended that the dimensions is set (either with width/height or other means) to prevent the UI jerkiness while loading.

fallback.description: Return an inline widget or specify a custom widget to be rendered when the image failed to load the image

onTap.description: Call Ensemble's built-in functions or execute code

onTapHaptic.description: The different types of haptic to play on Tap. The enums are in the decreasing order of intensity from highest intensity being of heavyImpact and lowest of selectionClick.

placeholderColor.description: The placeholder color while the image is loading.

fit.description: How to fit the image within our width/height or our parent (if dimension is not specified)

oneOf.description: Stretch our image to fill the dimension, and distorting the aspect ratio if needed
Scale the image such that the entire image is contained within our dimension
Scale the image to fill our dimension, clipping the image as needed
Scale the image to fit the width, and clipping the height if needed
Scale the image to fit the height, and clipping the width if needed
Center-Align the original image size, clipping the content if needed
Center-Align the image and only scale down to fit. Image will not be scaled up to bigger dimension.

resizedWidth.description: Images will be automatically resized (default to 800 width with no height set) before rendering. If you know the rough image width, set this number to be the same or a slightly larger width to optimize the loading time. To maintain the original aspect ratio, set either resizedWidth or resizedHeight, but not both. This setting is not supported on Web.

resizedHeight.description: Images will be automatically resized (default to 800 width with no height set) before rendering. If you know the rough image height, set this number to be the same or a slightly larger height to optimize the loading time. To maintain the original aspect ratio, set either resizedWidth or resizedHeight, but not both. This setting is not supported on Web.

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

source.description: URL to or asset name of the image. If the URL is used, it is highly recommended that the dimensions is set (either with width/height or other means) to prevent the UI jerkiness while loading.

variant.description: Specify the Avatar's shape: circle (default), square, or rounded.

name.description: If the image source is not specified or failed to load, this name's initials will be displayed

nameTextStyle.description: Adjust the text styling for the name

onTap.description: Call Ensemble's built-in functions or execute code

onTapHaptic.description: The different types of haptic to play on Tap. The enums are in the decreasing order of intensity from highest intensity being of heavyImpact and lowest of selectionClick.

fit.description: How to fit the image within our width/height or our parent (if dimension is not specified)

oneOf.description: Stretch our image to fill the dimension, and distorting the aspect ratio if needed
Scale the image such that the entire image is contained within our dimension
Scale the image to fill our dimension, clipping the image as needed
Scale the image to fit the width, and clipping the height if needed
Scale the image to fit the height, and clipping the width if needed
Center-Align the original image size, clipping the content if needed
Center-Align the image and only scale down to fit. Image will not be scaled up to bigger dimension.

placeholderColor.description: The placeholder color while the image is loading.

fit.description: How to fit the image within our width/height or our parent (if dimension is not specified)

oneOf.description: Stretch our image to fill the dimension, and distorting the aspect ratio if needed
Scale the image such that the entire image is contained within our dimension
Scale the image to fill our dimension, clipping the image as needed
Scale the image to fit the width, and clipping the height if needed

width.description: Set the width of the ImageCropper.

height.description: Set the height of the ImageCropper.

cropPercentage.description: How big the crop should be in regards to the width and height available to the cropping widget.

strokeWidth.description: The stroke width of the dotted path.

strokeColor.description: The stroke color of the dotted path.

isRotate.description: Whether to allow the image to be rotated. Defaults to true.

isMove.description: Determines whether moving gesture overlay is disabled. Defaults to true.

isScale.description: Determines whether scaling gesture is disabled. Defaults to true.

shape.description: The shape of the cropping path.

oneOf.description: Sets the cropper in circle shape.
Sets the cropper in square shape.
Sets the cropper in rectangle shape.

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

source.description: URL or asset name of the Lottie json file

onTap.description: Call Ensemble's built-in functions or execute code when tapped on lottie

onTapHaptic.description: The different types of haptic to play on Tap. The enums are in the decreasing order of intensity from highest intensity being of heavyImpact and lowest of selectionClick.

repeat.description: Whether we should repeat the animation (default true)

fit.description: How to fit the Lottie animation within our width/height or our parent (if dimension is not specified)

oneOf.description: Stretch our Lottie to fill the dimension, and distorting the aspect ratio if needed
Scale the Lottie such that the entire Lottie is contained within our dimension
Scale the Lottie to fill our dimension, clipping the Lottie as needed
Scale the Lottie to fit the width, and clipping the height if needed
Scale the Lottie to fit the height, and clipping the width if needed
Center-Align the original Lottie size, clipping the content if needed
Center-Align the Lottie and only scale down to fit. Lottie will not be scaled up to bigger dimension.

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

value.description: The data to generate the QR code

size.description: Specify the width/height of the QR Code. Default: 160

color.description: Set the color for the QR code drawing

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

countdown.description: Show the progress percentage based on the number of seconds specified here

onCountdownComplete.description: Execute this Action when the countdown comes to 0

size.description: Specifies the width (progress bar) or the diameter (circular progress indicator)

thickness.description: Specifies the thickness of the indicator (for progress bar this is the height)

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

direction.description: Whether to display a horizontal divider (default) or vertical divider.

color.description: The line color starting with '0xFF' for full opacity

indent.description: The leading gap before the line starts

endIndent.description: The ending gap after the line ends

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget
A unique identifier for this widget

value.description: Whether the toggle is On or Off (true or false)

inactiveWidget.description: The widget to render when the toggle is Off

activeWidget.description: The widget to render when the toggle is On

onChange.description: Action to execute when the toggle's value has changed

onChangeHaptic.description: The different types of haptic to play on change. The enums are in the decreasing order of intensity from highest intensity being of heavyImpact and lowest of selectionClick.

transitionDuration.description: The duration in milliseconds when transitioning between the active and inactive widgets

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

isFirst.description: Whether to display the firstWidget or secondWidget

onToggle.description: Action to execute when the widget being displayed has changed

transitionDuration.description: The duration in milliseconds when transitioning between the firstWidget and secondWidget (default 500ms)

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

isLoading.description: Whether to display a loading widget. The default will be empty (without shimmer) or a default loading shimmer, unless a loadingWidget is specified.

useShimmer.description: a shining animation to designate that the content is loading. The animation can be over a defaults shimmer or the loadingWidget if specified.

baseColor.description: The base color of the Shimmer.

highlightColor.description: The highlight color of the Shimmer.

widget.description: The main widget to show in non-loading state

loadingWidget.description: The widget to display in loading state. When enabling shimmer, ensure your widget has a background color for the animation to shine through.

defaultShimmerPadding.description: Specified the padding for the default shimmer widget (not applicable if loadingWidget is specified or useShimmer is not enabled).

widget.description: The widget to be rendered as the menu anchor. Note that any tap event (if specified) will be ignored and automatically intercepted to open/close the menu.

onItemSelect.description: Invoke an Action when a menu item is selected

value.description: The value returned when a menu item is selected. If not specified, the label will be return instead.

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

value.description: Specifying the value of your Text Input

mask.description: It formats the input by a given mask. Ex: +# (###) ###-##-##

obscureText.description: whether we should obscure the typed-in text (e.g Social Security)

obscureToggle.description: enable the toggling between plain and obscure text.

toolbarDone.description: enable the toolbar with done button in the TextInput. (defaults to False)

enableClearText.description: It enables the default suffix clear icon button for the text input field to clear the values. Default (false)

onDelayedKeyPress.description: Execute an Action after a brief delay specified by delayedKeyPressDuration (default: 300 ms). Consecutive calls within this delay will reset the timer, useful for minimizing server calls for type-ahead scenarios.

delayedKeyPressDuration.description: The delay in milliseconds to trigger onDelayedKeyPress

textStyle.description: Styling the input text. Default to theme's bodyMedium styling

hintStyle.description: Styling the hint text. Default to theme's bodyMedium styling

maxLines.description: max number of lines allowed in a textinput

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

obscureToggle.description: enable the toggling between plain and obscure text.

length.description: The number of the text fields

onChange.description: It is called when a change is detected to the text field

onComplete.description: It is called when the text field is completed

fieldType.description: How the input field should be displayed

length.description: The length of the Confirmation Input Field (default is 4)

fieldWidth.description: The width of the text field

fieldHeight.description: The height of the text field

gap.description: Horizontal gap to insert between the children (default is 10)

autoComplete.description: If it is True, then it will trigger onComplete when the user specified length and has typed the full length, False will trigger onComplete when the user hit Enter. Defaults (True)

spaceEvenly.description: If it is True, then it will arrange all the textfields eqaully based on the remaining space in the horizontal axis. Defaults (True)

enableCursor.description: If the button is inside a Form and upon on tap, it will execute the form's onSubmit action if this property is TRUE

defaultFieldBorderColor.description: Set the border color for inactive/unfocused state of text field

activeFieldBorderColor.description: Set the border color for active/focused state of text field

filledFieldBorderColor.description: Set the border color for filled state of text field

defaultFieldBackgroundColor.description: Set the background Color for inactive/unfocused state of text field

activeFieldBackgroundColor.description: Set the ackground Color for active/focused state of text field

filledFieldBackgroundColor.description: Set the ackground Color for filled field state of text field

cursorColor.description: Set the color for the cursor

id.description: ID to be referenced later

icon.description: The icon to show before the Date Range field

suffixIcon.description: The icon to show after the Date Range field

onChange.description: Call Ensemble's built-in functions or execute code when the input changes. Note for free-form text input, this event only dispatches if the text changes AND the focus is lost (e.g. clicking on button)

initialValue.description: Initial value where the slider thumb will start

min.description: Minimum value the user can pick

max.description: Maximum value the user can pick

divisions.description: If set slider will be divided into number passed to divisions else it will be continuous

onChange.description: Dispatch an action whenever slider is updated

activeColor.description: The active color of the Switch Widget.

inactiveColor.description: The inactive color of the Switch Widget.

activeThumbColor.description: The active thumb color of the Switch Widget.

inactiveThumbColor.description: The inactive thumb color of the Switch Widget.

unselectedColor.description: The outline color of the Checkbox Widget.

selectedColor.description: The background color of the Checkbox Widget.

checkColor.description: The tick color of the Checkbox Widget.

value.description: Select a value that matches one of the items. If Items are Objects, it should match the value key

items.description: List of values, or Objects with value/label pairs

autoComplete.description: Enable the Input search suggestion option

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

initialValue.description: The highlighted initial date in the calendar picker (default is Today). Use format YYYY-MM-DD.

firstDate.description: The first selectable date in the calendar. Use format YYYY-MM-DD

lastDate.description: The last selectable date in the calendar. Use format YYYY-MM-DD

showCalendarIcon.description: Whether we should show (default) or hide the calendar icon. Selecting the text will still open the calendar picker

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

initialValue.description: The highlighted initial time in the time picker. Use format HH:MM

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

widget.description: The widget to be rendered as the placeholder (not applicable on Web). Note that any tap event (if specified) will be ignored and automatically intercepted to trigger a Google Sign-In process.

scopes.description: A list of additional scopes to request permissions from the user

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

buttonStyle.description: Select an Apple's pre-defined button style (default whiteOutlined)

provider.description: Select a Sign In provider to use. By default 'local' provider is used

oneOf.description: Sign the user in on the client (default).
Use your custom Firebase to manage your users. Please see Ensemble documentation on how to integrate Firebase.
After authenticated the user, send the idToken to your Server to retrieve the credentials (e.g. bearer token, cookies, ...), then sign the user in on the client.

signInServerAPI.description:
Call this Server API to retrieve the server credentials to sign in:
1. Authenticate with Google, Apple, ..
2. Call your server with the idToken (accessible with ${idToken}) and expect the response to contain server-specific credentials necessary for subsequent access.
3. Client will set these credentials and sign the user in locally. The credentials are accessible with ${auth.user.data}
4. Subsequent server API calls can append these credentials to the requests.

setSignInCredentialsOnResponse.description: On server response, set any key/value pairs to save them as the user's credentials. The client will automatically sign the user in and have these key/value pairs available at ${auth.user.data}

onSignedIn.description: Execute an Action once the user has signed in.

overrideLabel.description: (Native only) Override the Sign In label. Note that changing the default Apple guideline may get your app rejected when submitting to Apple's App Store.

iconAlignment.description: Align the Apple icon to the left or center of the button (Note that the text will always be centered). Default: center

initialScopes.description: A list of initial scopes to request user's permission.

widget.description: The widget to be rendered in place of the default button. Note that any tap event on this widget (if specified) will be ignored and automatically intercepted to trigger an OAuth Connect flow.

tokenExchangeAPI.description: If the server needs access to the access/refresh token, the OAuth token exchange API can be specified. Please see Ensemble's documentation regarding the expected request/response format.

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

startingIcon.description: Icon placed in front of the label, according to device text alignment

endingIcon.description: Icon placed behind the label, according to device text alignment

gap.description: The gap between the starting icon and ending icon

submitForm.description: If the button is inside a Form and upon on tap, it will execute the form's onSubmit action if this property is TRUE

showRecent.description: Whether to show the recent searches (default True)

countryFilter.description: Specify a list of country codes (2-letter ISO standard) to filter the result (max of 5)

proximitySearchEnabled.description: Use the user's current location to prioritize localized results within the proximityRadius. Note that this will prompt for user's permission to access their location. (default: true)

proximitySearchCenter.description: Use the syntax 'latitude longitude' to specify the center used for prioritizing localized results. If specified, this will be used instead of the user's current location.

proximitySearchRadius.description: The radius (in meters) from the proximitySearchCenter (or current location) to prioritize localized results. (default 20,000 meters).

verticalGap.description: Vertical gap between the staggered grid tiles

horizontalGap.description: Horizontal gap between the staggered grid tiles

spacing.description: Space between the toggle buttons item

runSpacing.description: Space between the toggle buttons row

selectedColor.description: Set the color for the selected toggle button label

backgroundColor.description: Set the background color for the toggle button

selectedBackgroundColor.description: Set the background color for the selected toggle button

borderColor.description: Set the border color for the toggle button, starting with '0xFF' for full opacity

selectedBorderColor.description: Set the border color for the selected toggle button, starting with '0xFF' for full opacity

shadowColor.description: Set the shadow color for the toggle button

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

onSubmit.description: Action to execute when the form is submitted

labelPosition.description: Where the position the FormField's label

labelOverflow.description: Treatment of text longer than available space

labelMaxWidth.description: Cap the label's width, useful on larger screen. This property only works on labelPosition=start.

gap.description: Vertical gap to insert between the children (default is 10)

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

direction.description: The main direction to lay out the children before wrapping

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

onPullToRefresh.description: Trigger an Action with pull to refresh. Applicable only if scrollable is enabled.

refreshIndicatorType.description: The refresh indicator type if onPullToRefresh is specified. Default is 'material'.

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget
A unique identifier for this widget

onItemTap.description: Call Ensemble's built-in functions or execute code when tapping on an item in the list.

onItemTapHaptic.description: The different types of haptic to play on tap of item. The enums are in the decreasing order of intensity from highest intensity being of heavyImpact and lowest of selectionClick.

onScrollEnd.description: Execute an Ensemble action when user has reached bottom of grid.

horizontalTileCount.description: The number of horizontal tiles (max 5) to show. If not specified, the number of tiles will automatically be determined by the screen size. You may also specify a single number (for all breakpoints), three numbers (for small, medium, large breakpoints), or five numbers (xSmall, small, medium, large, xLarge).

horizontalGap.description: The gap between the horizontal tiles if there are more than one (default: 10).

verticalGap.description: The gap between the vertical tiles if there are more than one (default: 10).

itemHeight.description: Set a fixed height for each item in the tile. If each tile item comprises of many widgets vertically, setting this attribute may require you to stretch (expand) at least one inner widget.

itemAspectRatio.description: Instead of itemHeight, you can set the tile's dimension as a ratio of (item width / item height). For example, a tile with 3x width and 2x height is 3/2 = 1.5. This attribute will be ignored if itemHeight is set.

reverse.description: Show Grid in reverse order. Default is false

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

headingText.description: Set the text style for the heading text

font.description: Default built-in style for this text

dataText.description: Set the text style for the data item text

font.description: Default built-in style for this text

horizontalMargin.description: The leading and trailing gap for the DataGrid view.

dataRowHeight.description: Set the height of the data row item.

headingRowHeight.description: Set the height of the heading row item.

columnSpacing.description: Set the padding for the column.

columnIndex.description: The index of the data column to be sorted

order.description: Set the data column sorting either in ascending or descending order

oneOf.description: Sort the data column in ascending order
Sort the data column in descending order

data.description: Bind to an array of data from an API response or a variable

name.description: Set the name to reference as you iterate through the array of data

template.description: The data row widget to render for each item

DataColumn-Item.description: A DataColumn item for the data grid

label.description: Set the label of the data column

type.description: Set the type of the data column

tooltip.description: Set the tooltip for the data column

sortKey.description: Sort key is required if you enable the data column sorting

alignChildren.description: How to align the children within the stack such that their alignment points will be the same (default is topStart). Each child can override this with alignment property.

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

onItemTap.description: Dispatch when an ListView item is selected/tapped.The event dispatches only when you tap on the item. The index of the item can be retrieved using 'selectedItemIndex'.

onItemTapHaptic.description: The different types of haptic to play on tap of item. The enums are in the decreasing order of intensity from highest intensity being of heavyImpact and lowest of selectionClick.

selectedItemIndex.description: Selecting a ListView item gives the index of selected item

onScrollEnd.description: Execute an Ensemble action when user has reached bottom of list.

showSeparator.description: Show a separator between the items (default is true).

separatorColor.description: Set the color for the separator between items

separatorWidth.description: The thickness of the separator between items

separatorPadding.description: Padding with CSS-style value e.g. padding: 5 20 5 Default 0 0 0

reverse.description: Show list in reverse order. Default is false

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

onItemChange.description: Dispatch when an carousel item is in focus. For SingleView, this happens when the item is scroll into view. For scrolling MultiView, the event dispatches only when you tap on the item. The index of the item can be retrieved using 'selectedIndex'.

layout.description: Show a SingleView (on screen one at a time), MultiView (scrolling items), or automatically switch between the views with autoLayoutBreakpoint

autoLayoutBreakpoint.description: Show multiple views on the carousel if the breakpoint is equal or larger than this threshold, otherwise show single view. (default 768)

gap.description: The gap between each views, but also act as a left-right margin in a single view

leadingGap.description: The space before the first item. Note that the left edge of the scroll area is still controlled by padding or margin.

trailingGap.description: The space after the last item. Note that the right edge of the scroll area is still controlled by padding or margin.

singleItemWidthRatio.description: The screen width ratio for each carousel item (in single item mode). Value ranges from 0.0 to 1.0 for the full width. (default 1.0)

multipleItemWidthRatio.description: The screen width ratio for each carousel item (in multiple item mode). Value ranges from 0.0 to 1.0 for the full width (default 0.6)

indicatorType.description: How the view indicator should be displayed

indicatorPosition.description: Where to display the indicator if specified

autoplay.description: If true, Enables autoplay, sliding one page at a time. Default (false)

enableLoop.description: Determines if carousel should loop infinitely or be limited to item length. Default (false)

currentIndex.description: The initial page to show when first creating the Carousel and the current index of the displaying Carousel Item. Default (0)

selectedItemIndex.description: The initial page to show when first creating the Carousel and the current index of the displaying Carousel Item. Default (0)
selectedItemIndex.deprecationMessage: It is deprecated and removed in future. Use the 'currentIndex' property instead

indicatorMaxCount.description: This property is used to show a limited number (for ex: 4) of carousel indicator when creating the carousel with more (for ex: 100+) items. Default (null)

autoplayInterval.description: Sets the duration in seconds for the autoplay. Default (4 second)

data.description: Bind to an array of data from an API response or a variable

name.description: Set the name to reference as you iterate through the array of data

template.description: The widget to render for each item

onKeyPress.description: On every keystroke, call Ensemble's built-in functions or execute code

onFocusReceived.description: Execute an Ensemble action when the field receives focus

onFocusLost.description: Execute an Ensemble action when the field loses focus

id.description: ID to be referenced later

maxWidth.description: The max width of this Input widget (default 700)

icon.description: The icon to show before the Input field

onChange.description: Call Ensemble's built-in functions or execute code when the input changes. Note for free-form text input, this event only dispatches if the text changes AND the focus is lost (e.g. clicking on button)

variant.description: Select a pre-defined look and feel for this Input widget. This property can be defined in the theme to apply to all Input widgets.

oneOf.description: draw an Underline below this input widget. This property can be defined in the theme to apply to all Input widgets.
draw a Box border around this input widget. This property can be defined in the theme to apply to all Input widgets.

contentPadding.description: Padding around your input content with CSS-style notation e.g. margin: 5 20 5

fillColor.description: The fill color for this input fields. This property can be defined in the theme to apply to all Input widgets.

borderRadius.description: The border radius for this Input widget. This property can be defined in the theme to apply to all Input widgets.

borderWidth.description: The border width for this Input widget. This property can be defined in the theme to apply to all Input widgets.

borderColor.description: The base border color for this input widget. This border color determines the look and feel of your input, while the other colors are overrides for different states. This property can be defined in the theme to apply to all Input widgets.

disabledBorderColor.description: The border color when this input field is disabled. This property can be defined in the theme to apply to all Input widgets.

errorBorderColor.description: The border color when there are errors on this input field. This property can be defined in the theme to apply to all Input widgets.

focusedBorderColor.description: The border color when this input field is receiving focus. This property can be defined in the theme to apply to all Input widgets.

focusedErrorBorderColor.description: The border color of this input field when it is receiving focus in its error state. This property can be defined in the theme to apply to all Input widgets.

floatLabel.description: Moves the label on top of the Input Field. Default (False).

floatingLabelStyle.description: Set the label's styles when it is in floating mode

keyboardAction.description: Specify the action key on native device's soft keyboard

oneOf.description: show the keyboard action that represents completion (e.g. Android's checkmark, iOS's Done)
show the keyboard action that represents go (e.g. Android's right arrow, iOS's Done)
show the keyboard action that represents search
show the keyboard action that represents send
Move the focus to the next focusable field
Move the focus to the previous focusable field

navigateBack.description: Navigating back to the previous screen if possible. The current screen will be removed from the navigation history. This also works for a modal screen.

payload.description: Pass a payload of key/value pairs to the original screen that we are navigating back to.

name.description: Enter the Name or ID of your Screen

external.description: (Default false) Specify if screen is externally provided or not. If set true the screen is expected from external source.

inputs.description: Specify the key/value pairs to pass into the next Screen

replaceCurrentScreen.description: If true, the new screen will replace the current screen on the navigation history. Navigating back from the new screen will skip the current screen.

clearAllScreens.description: If true, clear out all existing screens in the navigation history. This is useful when navigating to a Logout or similar page where users should not be able to go back to the prior screens.

onNavigateBack.description: Invoke an Action when navigating back to this screen. The data (if specified by the removed screen) can be accessed with ${event.data})

navigateExternalScreen.description: Navigating to a native screen outside of Ensemble (only iOS screens are currently supported - additional integration is required)

inputs.description: Specify the key/value pairs to pass into the Screen

navigateViewGroup.description: Navigate between the screens in the view group. It is applicable only when inside a ViewGroup

viewIndex.description: Enter the index of the screen to navigate

navigateModalScreen.description: Navigating to a new screen as a modal

name.description: Enter the Name or ID of your screen

inputs.description: Specify the key/value pairs to pass into the next Screen

onModalDismiss.description: Execute an Action when the modal screen is dismissed

showBottomModal.description: Open a view as a bottom modal sheet

body.description: The custom widget to show as the bottom modal sheet.

onDismiss.description: Triggers an Action upon the Bottom Modal's dismissal. A payload (if specified) is available on 'event.data'

enableDrag.description: Whether to drag a bottom modal sheet (default is True)

enableDragHandler.description: Whether to show a drag handle divider on top of the bottom modal sheet for dragging (default is False)

backgroundColor.description: By default the background color uses the theme's 'bottomSheetTheme.backgroundColor'. You can override the bottom modal sheet's background color here.

barrierColor.description: By default the barrierColor color use theme's 'bottomSheetTheme.modalBarrierColor' . You can override the bottom modal sheet's barrierColor color here.

payload.description: Pass a payload of key/value pairs to the Bottom Modal's onDismiss action

openPlaidLink.description: It will open the Plaid Link Service

linkToken.description: Enter the Plaid Link Token. It can be created from /link/token/create endpoint of Plaid

onSuccess.description: It is called when a user successfully links an Item

onEvent.description: It is called when certain events in the Plaid Link flow have occurred, for example, when the user selected an institution. This enables your application to gain further insight into what is going on as the user goes through the Plaid Link flow

onExit.description: It is called when a user exits Link without successfully linking an Item, or when an error occurs during Link initialization

receiveIntent.description: To receive photos, videos, texts, urls or any other files which is shared from another app

onReceive.description: It is called when the data received successfully from another app

onError.description: It is called when it is failed to receive the data which is shared from another app

getPhoneContacts.description: It allows to get the contacts from the device

onSuccess.description: It is called when it's fetched the device contacts successfully

onError.description: It is called when the action failed to get the device contacts

openUrl.description: Open URL in ensemble or a separate app

openInExternalApp.description: Open URL in an external app

id.description: Give the camera an ID, allows you to bind to its result. e.g. ${cameraId.files...}

onComplete.description: Execute an Action after completing capturing media

onClose.description: Execute an Action on camera close

onCapture.description: Execute an Action on each capture

mode.description: Modes of camera. It can be photo only i.e allows to capture just photo. Similarly video or can be both.

initialCamera.description: Initialize either camera, back or front

allowGalleryPicker.description: Allow users to pick media from gallery. Default (true).

allowCameraRotate.description: Allow users rotate camera i.e back and front. Default (true).

allowFlashControl.description: Allow users to control flash options. Default (true).

preview.description: If set true, users can view captured/selected media.

instantPreview.description: If set true, users can view captured/selected media instantly as soon as it's capture.

maxCount.description: It used to control maximum number of media that can be captured/selected

maxCountMessage.description: Custom message to show when captured/selected media is greater than maxCount

minCount.description: It used to control minimum number of media that can be captured/selected

minCountMessage.description: Custom message to show when captured/selected media is lesser than minCount

permissionDeniedMessage.description: Set custom message when access to camera is denied

nextButtonLabel.description: Set custom label on next button.

cameraRotateIcon.description: Set custom icon for camera rotate button

galleryPickerIcon.description: Set custom icon for gallery picker button

focusIcon.description: Set custom icon for focus node.

assistAngle.description: Show assist message whenever angle goes below minAngle or above minAngle

maxAngleassistAngleMessage.description: Custom message to show when condition is hit.

assistSpeed.description: Show assist message whenever camera is moving faster than maxSpeed

assistSpeedMessage.description: Custom message to show when condition is hit.

autoCaptureInterval.description: If set any number n, on each n interval camera will capture

widget.description: Return an inline widget or specify a custom widget's name to use in the dialog.

horizontalOffset.description: Offset the dialog's position horizontally, with -1.0 for the screen's left and 1.0 for the screen's right. (default is 0 for centering horizontally)

verticalOffset.description: Offset the dialog's position vertically, with -1.0 for the screen's top and 1.0 for the screen's bottom. (default is 0 for centering vertically)

style.description: Render the dialog with a default style. You can also specify 'none' and control your own styles in your widget.

onDialogDismiss.description: Execute an Action when the dialog is dismissed.

startTimer.description: Initiating the start of a timer

id.description: Give this timer an ID so it can be cancelled by a stopTimer action

onTimer.description: Execute an Action every time the timer triggers

onTimerComplete.description: Execute an Action when the timer has completed and will terminate

isGlobal.description: Marking this timer as global will ensure the timer, if repeating indefinitely, will continue to run even if the user navigates away from the screen, until explicitly stopped by the stopTimer action. Note that there can only ever be one global timer. Creating a new global timer will automatically cancel the previous global timer.

startAfter.description: Delay the timer's start by this number of seconds. If not specified and repeat is true, repeatInterval will be used. If none is specified, there will be no initial delay

repeat.description: Whether the time should repeat and trigger at every repeatInterval seconds. This Timer will run continuously unless a maxNumberOfTimes is specified

repeatInterval.description: Trigger the timer periodically at this repeatInterval (in seconds)

maxNumberOfTimes.description: Set the max number of times the timer will triggers, if repeat is true

stopTimer.description: Stop a timer if it is running

id.description: Stop the timer with this ID if it is running

message.description: The toast message. Either this message or a widget must be provided.

widget.description: The custom widget to show as the Toast's body. Either this widget or a toast message must be provided.

dismissible.description: Whether to show a dismiss button (default is True)

duration.description: The number of seconds before the toast is dismissed

shadowColor.description: box shadow color starting with '0xFF' for full opacity

body.description: Define your code block here, starting with //@code

onComplete.description: Execute another Action when the code body finishes executing

getLocation.description: Requesting user's permission to get his/her current location

recurring.description: Whether to continuously get the device location on this screen. Note that a screen can only have one recurring location listener. Adding multiple recurring location listeners will cancel the previous one.

recurringDistanceFilter.description: If recurring, the minimum distance (in meters) the device has moved before new location is returned. (default: 1000 meters, minimum: 50 meters)

onLocationReceived.description: Callback Action once we get the device location

onError.description: Callback Action if we are unable to get the device location. Reason is available under 'reason' field

uploadFiles.description: Allow users to upload files to an API from the camera or file system

id.description: Give the uploadApi an ID, allows you to bind to its result. e.g. ${apiId.body...}

uploadApi.description: Enter the name of your defined API

onComplete.description: Execute another Action upon successful upload of files

onError.description: Execute an Action when uploader fails with error(s)

inputs.description: Define the list of input names that upload API accepts

fieldName.description: Field name that your server is expecting (default files)

files.description: Binded files from sources like camera or picker. e.g ${filePicker.files}, ${camerId.files}

batchSize.description: If specified, the total set of files to be uploaded will be divided into batches, with each batch containing a number of files equal to batchSize

maxFileSize.description: File size that is allowed (default 100 mb), If multiple is allow then sum of all files

overMaxFileSizeMessage.description: Error message to show when selected files size is above maxFileSize.

backgroundTask.description: If set true, uploading will be done in background.

showNotification.description: If set true, progress will be show in notification bar.

id.description: Give the picker an ID allows you to bind to its result, which can be access anywhere e.g. ${filePicker.files...}

source.description: Source define where you can pick files. Default files.

allowMultiple.description: Allow users to pick multiple files (default False)

allowCompression.description: It will allow media to apply the default OS compression (default True)

allowedExtensions.description: Allow files with specific extension e.g jpg, png, pdf

copyToClipboard.description: Copy the text to the clipboard

value.description: The text to copy to clipboard

onSuccess.description: Execute another Action upon successful copy to clipboard

onFailure.description: Execute an Action when copy to clipboard fails

rateApp.description: (iOS only) Prompt the user to rate this App

invokeHaptics.description: Play a given haptic on mobile.

type.description: The different types of haptic to play. The enums are in the decreasing order of intensity from highest intensity being of heavyImpact and lowest of selectionClick.

updateBadgeCount.description: Update the app's badge count (applicable on iOS, MacOS, and some Android devices only). Notifications must also be enabled for this to work properly.

count.description: Update the app's badge count (applicable on iOS, MacOS, and some Android devices)

clearBadgeCount.description: Clear the app's badge count (applicable on iOS, MacOS, and some Android devices only). Notifications must also be enabled for this to work properly.

connectWallet.description: Allow users connect to crypto wallet

id.description: ID allows you to bind to its result. e.g. ${wallet.addresses...},

wcProjectId.description: Wallet connect project Id, get it from wallet connect dashboard

onComplete.description: Execute another Action upon successful upload of files

onError.description: Execute an Action when uploader fails with error(s)

name.description: Your app name, that will be shared to crypto wallet

description.description: Your app's description, that will be shared to crypto wallet

iconUrl.description: Url path of your app's icon

requestNotificationAccess.description: Request user permission to send notifications to the device

onAccept.description: Execute an Action when notification permission has been granted

onReject.description: Execute an Action when notification permission has been rejected

showNotification.description: Show notification this is local notification.

onTap.description: Execute an Action on notification is tap.

onReceive.description: Execute an Action on notification is receive.

checkPermission.description: Check for user permissions for certain device capabilities

onAuthorized.description: Execute an Action if this permission was authorized by the user.

onDenied.description: Execute an Action if this permission was denied by the user.

onNotDetermined.description: Execute an Action if we can't determine the permission's status. Note that this state is not applicable on Android.

connectSocket.description: Connect to a given socket name.

name.description: Enter the name of your defined socket

inputs.description: Specify the key/value pairs to pass to the socket

onSuccess.description: Execute this callback upon a successful connection of socket with server.

onError.description: Execute this callback upon a encountering error while trying to do socket connection.

disconnectSocket.description: Disconnect socket to a given name.

name.description: Enter the name of your defined socket

messageSocket.description: Send a message to a given socket name.

name.description: Enter the name of your defined socket

message.description: Specify the key/value pairs to pass to the socket

callExternalMethod.description: Call an external method defined outside of Ensemble

name.description: The method name defined in your code

payload.description: The key/value pairs payload to be sent as the input parameters for your method

onComplete.description: Called when the method has finished its execution. Return value (if any) is available under 'event.data'

onError.description: Called when there is an error while executing the method. The error reason is available under 'event.error'

oneOf.title: Call a native method defined inside the Host Platform

callNativeMethod.description: Call a native method defined in the Host Platform

name.description: The method channel name defined in your host platform

payload.description: The key/value pairs payload to be sent as the input parameters for your method

onComplete.description: Called when the method has finished its execution

onError.description: Called when there is an error while executing the method. The error reason is available under 'event.error'

oneOf.title: Verify if the user is currently signed in

verifySignIn.description: Verify if the user is currently signed in or not

onSignedIn.description: Execute an Action if the user is currently signed in

onNotSignedIn.description: Execute an Action if the user is currently not signed in, or if the status is unknown.

signOut.description: Sign the user out (if currently signed in) and clear the user's data ${auth.user}

onComplete.description: Execute an Action once the user has signed out.

Margin-payload.description: Margin with CSS-style notation (1 to 4 integers) e.g. margin: 5 20 5

Padding-payload.description: Padding with CSS-style notation (1 to 4 integers) e.g. padding: 5 20 5

reloadView.description: It will reload the page each time when clicking the menu item

icon.description: Icon name from Material Icons or Font Awesome

page.description: The new page to navigate to on click

selected.description: Mark this item as selected. There should only be one selected item per page.

color.description: Unselected icon color, starting with '0xFF' for full opacity e.g 0xFFCCCCCC

selectedColor.description: Selected icon color, starting with '0xFF' for full opacity e.g 0xFFCCCCCC

backgroundColor.description: Background color, starting with '0xFF' for full opacity e.g 0xFFCCCCCC

floatingBackgroundColor.description: Floating item background color, starting with '0xFF' for full opacity e.g 0xFFCCCCCC

floatingIconColor.description: Floating item icon color, starting with '0xFF' for full opacity e.g 0xFFCCCCCC

height.description: Set the height of the BottomNavBar.

reloadView.description: It will reload the page each time when clicking the menu item

icon.description: Icon name from Material Icons or Font Awesome

page.description: The new page to navigate to on click

selected.description: Mark this item as selected. There should only be one selected item per page.

activeIcon.description: Icon name from Material Icons or Font Awesome

floating.description: Mark this item as a floating icon

switchScreen.description: Disable the screen switching when clicking the bottom nav bar item. Default (True)

onTapHaptic.description: The different types of haptic to play on tap. The enums are in the decreasing order of intensity from highest intensity being of heavyImpact and lowest of selectionClick.

floatingAlignment.description: How to align the floating in the BottomNavBar. The values are left, center, right and none

widget.description: Custom bottom navigation item for the unselected state

selectedWidget.description: Custom bottom navigation item for the selected state

header.description: The header widget for the menu

minSize.description: Minimum size of till sheet can go. Default is 0.25 i.e 25% of screen.

maxSize.description: Maximum size of till sheet can go. Default is 1 i.e 100% of screen.

span.description: Whether the widget should snap between [snapSizes] when the user lifts their finger during a drag.

spanSizes.description: The list of number each ranging from minSize to maxSize.

reloadView.description: It will reload the page each time when clicking the menu item

itemDisplay.description: How to render each navigation item

itemPadding.description: Padding for each navigation item with CSS-style value

minWidth.description: The minimum width for the menu (default 200)

backgroundColor.description: Background color, starting with '0xFF' for full opacity e.g 0xFFCCCCCC

highlightColor.description: Range Highlight color, starting with '0xFF' for full opacity e.g 0xFFCCCCCC

onStart.description: Call Ensemble's built-in functions or execute code when tapping on start of range

onComplete.description: Call Ensemble's built-in functions or execute code when tapping on complete of range

startCell.description: Configure or create custom cell where the range begin

endCell.description: Configure or create custom cell where the range end

betweenCell.description: Configure or create custom cell for all cells in between start and end of range

FittedColumn.description: Stretch to fit the parent (the parent is required to have a predetermined height), then distribute the vertical spaces evenly among its children. You can override the space distribution via 'childrenFits' attribute.

FittedRow.description: Stretch to fit the parent (the parent is required to have a predetermined width), then distribute the horizontal spaces evenly among its children. You can override the space distribution via 'childrenFits' attribute.

id.description: A unique identifier for this widget

firstDay.description: First day from where calendar begin. Default is CurrentDate - 12 months

lastDay.description: Last day where calendar end. Default is CurrentDate + 12 months

headerVisible.description: Set visibility of calendar header. Default true.

text.description: The text to display in the tooltip.

backgroundColor.description: The background color of the on tooltip

spanPerRow.description: Limit the number of spans per row

overflowWidget.description: If spans per row overflow based on spanPerRow than overflowWidget will render

onTap.description: Execute an Action when the map's bound has changed. The bound data is available using `event.data.bounds.<southwest/northeast>.<lat/lng>`.

selectCell.description: Configure or create custom cell for all selected dates

markCell.description: Configure or create custom cell for all marked dates

todayCell.description: Configure or create custom cell for today's date only

disableCell.description: Configure or create custom cell for disabled dates

Menu.description: Specify the navigation menu for this page

Drawer.description: Put the menu behind a drawer icon on the header. The drawer icon will be positioned to the 'start' of the header (left for most languages, right for RTL languages).

EndDrawer.description: Put the menu behind a drawer icon on the header. The drawer icon will be positioned to the 'end' of the header (right for most languages, left for RTL languages).

Sidebar.description: Enable a fixed navigation menu to the 'start' of the screen (left for most languages, right for RTL languages). The menu may become a drawer menu on lower resolution.

id.description: The unique identifier for this widget

tabPosition.description: How to lay out the Tab labels

oneOf.description: Align the labels to the start of the container and scroll if necessary
Distribute the labels evenly across available container width. Labels will be cut off instead of scrolling

indicatorSize.description: Defines how the bounds of the selected tab indicator are computed

oneOf.description: The tab indicator's bounds are as wide as the space occupied by the tab in the tab bar
The tab's bounds are only as wide as the label or icon width

tabPadding.description: Padding for each tab labels with CSS-style value. Default: 0 30 0 0 (right padding only)

tabFontSize.description: Font size for the tab text

tabFontWeight.description: Font weight for the tab text

tabBackgroundColor.description: The background color of the tab's navigation bar

activeTabColor.description: The color of the selected tab's text

dividerColor.description: The color of the tabbar divider color

inactiveTabColor.description: The color of the un-selected tabs' text

indicatorColor.description: The color of the selected tab's indicator

activeTabBackgroundColor.description: The background color of the selected tab

indicatorThickness.description: The thickness of the selected tab's indicator

selectedIndex.description: Selecting a Tab based on its index order

items.description: Define each of your Tab here

widget.description: Return an inline widget or specify a custom widget to be rendered as this tab's content

tabItem.description: Return an inline widget or specify a custom widget to be rendered as this tab bar item

id.description: The unique identifier for this widget

autoZoom.description: Automatically zoom the maps to show all the markers (and optionally the current location). Default True.

showToolbar.description: Show the Map toolbar that contains some convenience controls. You can also turn each individual controls on or off.

showMapTypesButton.description: Toggle between the different map types. (default true)

showLocationButton.description: Show the button that animates to the user's location. (default true)

showZoomButtons.description: Applicable on Web only. Show the zoom in/out controls on the map. (default true on Web)

toolbarMargin.description: The margin around the toolbar. (default 10 on all sides)

toolbarAlignment.description: How to align the toolbar within the map. (default bottom right). If both positioning (top/bottom/left/right) and alignment are used, positions will be applied first, then alignment within the available constraint.

toolbarTop.description: Offset the toolbar from the top edge of the map

toolbarBottom.description: Offset the toolbar from the bottom edge of the map

toolbarLeft.description: Offset the toolbar from the left edge of the map

toolbarRight.description: Offset the toolbar from the right edge of the map

initialCameraPosition.description: Using the format 'latitude longitude', specify the initial camera position when the map loads.

initialCameraZoom.description: The initial zoom value to use when the map first load

markerOverlayMaxWidth.description: Marker overlay stretches to fill available horizontal space. Use this to cap its width on larger screens. (default 500)

markerOverlayMaxHeight.description: Set the max height of the marker overlay. (default: 50% of the screen height)

scrollableMarkerOverlay.description: If using overlay and there are more than one marker, swiping left/right within the overlay will navigate to next/previous marker

dismissibleMarkerOverlay.description: Enabling swiping down to close the overlay.

autoSelect.description: Automatically select a marker (if not already) when the markers are updated.

onCameraMove.description: Execute an Action when the map's bound has changed. The bound data is available using `event.data.bounds.<southwest/northeast>.<lat/lng>`.

onMapCreated.description: Execute an Action when the map's initial state has been rendered. Note that this may not mean the location and markers (if any) are available yet.

data.description: Bind the marker list to the data e.g. myAPI.body.items

name.description: Give this a name. This is the bindable data for each marker.

location.description: Specify the coordinates for this marker using the format 'latitude longitude'

source.description: The marker's image asset. This can come from URL or from local asset.
The marker's image asset when selected. This can come from URL or from local asset.

overlayWidget.description: The widget to render as an overlay over the maps. Use this to convey more detail info for each marker.

onMarkerTap.description: Execute an Action when tapping on the marker

onMarkersUpdated.description: Execute an Action when the markers have been updated and rendered.

id.description: The unique identifier for this widget

source.description: The URL source to the media file

id.description: The unique identifier for this widget

url.description: The URL source to the youTube video

autoplay.description: Automatically start the video when player is loaded. (default False)

videoList.description: List of videos to be played within a single player.

startSeconds.description: specifies the time from which the first video in the list(or single video) should start playing

endSeconds.description: Ends the video after the certain number of seconds (works with Single video)

showAnnotations.description: Showing the annotations of the video

playbackRate.description: For changing the speed at which the video is displayed

showControls.description: For showing the controls on the video within the player(Like in youtube)

showFullScreenButton.description: To show the fullscreen button of the video

enableCaptions.description: To enable any captions in the video(default language of caption is English)

videoPosition.description: To add an indicator for the amount of video that is completed

id.description: The unique identifier for this widget

url.description: The URl that will be loaded in the webview

headers.description: Pass the headers' key/value pairs to your service

cookies.description: takes cookies in an array of maps

cookieHeader.description: Creates a cookie by parsing a header value from a 'set-cookie' header according to the rules in RFC 6265

width.description: By default the width will match its parent's available width, but you can set an explicit width here.

height.description: If no height is specified, the web view will stretch its height to fit its content, in which case a scrollable parent is required to scroll the content. You may override this behavior by explicitly set the web view's height here, or uses 'expanded' to fill the available height.

id.description: ID to be referenced later

config.description:
Chartjs config. 
See this for an example - https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/configuration/

id.description: Give the API an ID allows you to bind to its result. e.g. ${apiId.body...}

name.description: Enter the name of your defined API

inputs.description: Specify the key/value pairs to pass to the API

onResponse.description: Execute another Action upon API's successful response

onError.description: Execute an Action when the API completes with error(s)

expanded.description: If the parent is a Row or Column, this flag will stretch this widget in the appropriate direction. (e.g stretch horizontally for parent of type Row)

visible.description: Toggle a widget visibility on/off. Note that an invisible widget will not occupy UI space, unless the visibilityTransitionDuration is specified.

visibilityTransitionDuration.description: Specify the duration in seconds when a widget animates between visible and not visible state. Note that setting this value will cause the widget to still occupy the UI space even when it is not visible.

elevation.description: The z-coordinate at which to place this material relative to its parent. A non-zero value will show a shadow, with its size relative to the elevation value.

elevationShadowColor.description: The shadow color for the elevation

elevationBorderRadius.description: If the widget has a borderRadius, this should be changed to have the same value.

alignment.description: Align this widget relative to its parent

stackPositionTop.description: The distance of the child's top edge from the top of the stack. This is applicable only for Stack's children.

stackPositionBottom.description: The distance that the child's bottom edge from the bottom of the stack. This is applicable only for Stack's children.

stackPositionLeft.description: The distance that the child's left edge from the left of the stack. This is applicable only for Stack's children.

stackPositionRight.description: The distance that the child's right edge from the right of the stack. This is applicable only for Stack's children.

captureWebPointer.description: Applicable for Web only. When overlaying widgets on top of certain HTML container (e.g. Maps), the mouse click is captured by the HTML container, causing issue interacting with the widget. Use this to capture and maintain the mouse pointer on your widget.

borderRadius.description: Border Radius with CSS-like notation (1 to 4 integers)

clipContent.description: Some widgets (such as Image) may bleed through the container when borderRadius is set. Use this to apply a clipping to ensure this does not happen.

fontFamily.description: Set the font family applicable for all widgets inside this container

crossAxis.description: Control the vertical alignment of the children

childrenFits.description: Specify an array of non-zero integers or 'auto', each corresponding to a child. Setting 'auto' will let the child determines its own size, while setting a non-zero integer will determine the child's size multiple. The 'auto' children will be laid out first and get as much space as they need, then the left-over space will be distributed to the other children based on their size multiples.

oneOf.description: Allow this selected child to determine its own size. This may give an error if the child doesn't have a dimension.
Default 1. After laying out the 'auto' children, the left-over space will be divided up based on this multiple.

gap.description: The gap between the children in the main direction

lineGap.description: The gap between the lines if the children start wrapping

crossAxis.description: Control the horizontal alignment of the children

mainAxisSize.description: If 'max', stretch the Column to fill its parent's height. Otherwise (min) the column's height will be its children's combined.

scrollable.description: Set to true so content can scroll vertically as needed

autoFit.description: Explicitly make the column's width as wide as the largest child, but only if our column's parent does not already assign a width. This attribute is useful for sizing children who don't have a width (e.g Divider)

crossAxis.description: Control the vertical alignment of the children

mainAxisSize.description: If 'max', stretch the Row to fill its parent's width. Otherwise (min) the Row's width will be its children's combined.

scrollable.description: Set to true so content can scroll horizontally as needed

autoFit.description: Explicitly make the row's height as tall as the largest child, but only if the row's parent does not already assign us a height. This attribute is useful for sizing children who don't have a width (e.g vertical Divider)

direction.description: Lay out the children vertically or horizontally

mainAxis.description: Control how to lay out the children, in the direction specified by the 'direction' attribute

crossAxis.description: Control the alignment of the children on the secondary axis (depending on the 'direction' attribute)

mainAxisSize.description: If 'max', stretch the Flex to fill its parent's dimension (width or height based on the direction). Otherwise (min) the Flex's dimension will be its children's combined.

scrollable.description: Set to true so content can scroll vertically or horizontally as needed

autoFit.description: Explicitly match the width or height to the largest child's size, but only if the parent does not already assign a width or height. This attribute is useful for sizing children who don't have a width or height (e.g Divider)

backgroundColor.description: Background color, starting with '0xFF' for full opacity e.g 0xFFCCCCCC

colors.description: The list of colors used for the gradient

stops.description: The list of color stops, each is a number between 0.0 (where the gradient starts) and 1.0 (where the gradient ends). The number of stops should match the number of colors.

start.description: The starting position of the gradient

end.description: The ending position of the gradient

source.description: The Image URL to fill the background

fallback.description: Return an inline widget or specify a custom widget to be rendered when the backgroundImage failed to load the image

fit.description: How to fit the image within our width/height or our parent (if dimension is not specified)

oneOf.description: Stretch our image to fill the dimension, and distorting the aspect ratio if needed
Scale the image such that the entire image is contained within our dimension
Scale the image to fill our dimension, clipping the image as needed
Scale the image to fit the width, and clipping the height if needed
Scale the image to fit the height, and clipping the width if needed
Center-Align the original image size, clipping the content if needed
Center-Align the image and only scale down to fit. Image will not be scaled up to bigger dimension.

regex.description: The Regular Expression the input will need to match

regexError.description: The customized error message to show when the input does not match the provided regex.

borderColor.description: Border color, starting with '0xFF' for full opacity

shadowColor.description: Box shadow color starting with '0xFF' for full opacity

shadowStyle.description: The blur style to apply on the shadow

oneOf.description: Fuzzy inside and outside (default).
Solid inside, fuzzy outside.
Nothing inside, fuzzy outside.
Fuzzy inside, nothing outside.

HasIcon.description: Specifies the icon to use. You can also use the short-handed syntax 'iconName iconLibrary')

onPullToRefresh.description: Trigger an Action with pull to refresh

indicatorType.description: Indicate the refresh indicator look-and-feel if onPullToRefresh is specified. Default is 'material'.

indicatorMinDuration.description: The minimum duration in milliseconds that the indicator will be shown, regardless if the onPullToRefresh's Action has completed or not.

indicatorPadding.description: The padding around the refresh indicator

lineHeightMultiple.description: A multiple of the fontSize to determine the line height. (e.g. 2.0 means the line height is double the height the font size occupies). Default null. (note that 1.0 is not the default depending on the font)

colors.description: The list of colors used for the gradient

stops.description: The list of color stops, each is a number between 0.0 (where the gradient starts) and 1.0 (where the gradient ends). The number of stops should match the number of colors.

start.description: The starting position of the gradient

end.description: The ending position of the gradient

decorationStyle.description: The style of the decoration (ignored if decoration=none)

overflow.description: Set treatment of text longer than available space
